item.title: doot
item.description: doot ðŸ“¯ Repository: https://codeberg.org/cyberme0w/doot doot is a bash script (doot.sh) which doots your doot files into their respective doot folders, for better doot portability and easier doot setup. But why? Aren’t there already tools for that? I’ve tried a couple alternatives to manage my dotfiles and while some of them are better than others, none of them really behaved the way I need. Some close calls over the years have been:

item.title: Initial Commit: Open Bike
item.description: Codeberg Repository: https://codeberg.org/cyberme0w/open-bike F-Droid: https://f-droid.org/packages/dev.cyberme0w.openbike/ For the uninitiated, nextbike is a bike-sharing company. Users pay a fee and can rent bikes from multiple stations within a city, with some cities offering ‘floating’ bikes, which can be rented and returned anywhere. I myself have been a mostly happy customer of nextbike for some time now. In my case, not having to deal with maintenance, as well as not using up precious space in my small apartment are great benefits.
